items.title: Trump grants automakers one-month exemption from tariffs
items.content: The White House said it granted a one-month delay for tariffs on automakers whose cars comply with USMCA, which was negotiated during Trump's first term.
items.contentSnippet: The White House said it granted a one-month delay for tariffs on automakers whose cars comply with USMCA, which was negotiated during Trump's first term.

items.title: These are the most competitive rental markets in the U.S.
items.content: Even with a record amount of new supply, demand for rental apartments is soaring. That has the competition heating up.
items.contentSnippet: Even with a record amount of new supply, demand for rental apartments is soaring. That has the competition heating up.

items.title: Abercrombie & Fitch shares plunge 15% after star retailer posts weak guidance for year ahead
items.content: Abercrombie & Fitch's business may be leveling out after two years of explosive growth.
items.contentSnippet: Abercrombie & Fitch's business may be leveling out after two years of explosive growth.

items.title: Novo Nordisk offers Wegovy for less than half the price through new direct-to-consumer pharmacy
items.content: The pharmacy, called NovoCare, will allow patients to pay $499 in cash per month for the blockbuster weight loss drug.
items.contentSnippet: The pharmacy, called NovoCare, will allow patients to pay $499 in cash per month for the blockbuster weight loss drug.

items.title: Amgen starts two critical late-stage trials for weight loss drug MariTide
items.content: MariTide is a monthly injection that investors hope could compete against existing weight loss drugs from Novo Nordisk and Eli Lilly.
items.contentSnippet: MariTide is a monthly injection that investors hope could compete against existing weight loss drugs from Novo Nordisk and Eli Lilly.

items.title: David's Bridal taps new CEO as it looks to become media company, build online marketplace
items.content: David's Bridal, which has emerged from two bankruptcies, is working to become a media company and marketplace that uses vendors to produce and ship products.

items.title: NHL commissioner says league could be affected by U.S.-Canada tariffs

items.title: Foot Locker results show the sneaker industry — and Nike — still have more pain ahead
items.content: Foot Locker is expecting profits to be under pressure in fiscal 2025, indicating steep discounts are still present across the industry, especially at Nike.
items.contentSnippet: Foot Locker is expecting profits to be under pressure in fiscal 2025, indicating steep discounts are still present across the industry, especially at Nike.

items.title: U.S. Olympic committee announces $100 million grant to fund athletes into their future
items.content: Every Olympic and Paralympic athlete who participates in the 2026 Milan games and future games through at least 2032 will receive $200,000 in financial benefits.
items.contentSnippet: Every Olympic and Paralympic athlete who participates in the 2026 Milan games and future games through at least 2032 will receive $200,000 in financial benefits.

items.title: Here's how tariffs will hit the U.S. housing market
items.content: Tariffs could increase builder costs anywhere from $7,500 to $10,000 per home, according to the chief economist of the National Association of Home Builders.
items.contentSnippet: Tariffs could increase builder costs anywhere from $7,500 to $10,000 per home, according to the chief economist of the National Association of Home Builders.

items.title: Trump's tariffs could quickly cut North American auto production by a third
items.content: A third of North American vehicle production could be cut by next week as a result of Trump's 25% tariffs on Mexico and Canada, S&P Global Mobility reports.
items.contentSnippet: A third of North American vehicle production could be cut by next week as a result of Trump's 25% tariffs on Mexico and Canada, S&P Global Mobility reports.

items.title: Southwest Airlines closing 2 crew bases in cost-cutting push
items.content: Southwest plans to close crew bases in Fort Lauderdale, Florida, and Austin, Texas.
items.contentSnippet: Southwest plans to close crew bases in Fort Lauderdale, Florida, and Austin, Texas.

items.title: CFPB drops lawsuit against JPMorgan Chase, Bank of America and Wells Fargo over Zelle fraud

items.title: Target to expand online marketplace, boost product assortment as it aims for $15 billion in sales growth by 2030

items.title: How a $5 million fix turned Paramount Pictures' 'Sonic' into a billion-dollar franchise

items.title: With $1 billion in salary IOUs, the Dodgers spark new questions about MLB's fairness
